statement.p: Explain why the vectors \left[\begin{array}{r} -6 \\ 0 \\ 0 \\ 0 \\ -2 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 2 \\ 2 \\ -6 \\ -6 \\ 0 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -2 \\ 5 \\ 1 \\ 2 \\ -1 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -8 \\ -1 \\ 19 \\ 20 \\ -1 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{r} -5 \\ 4 \\ -1 \\ -4 \\ -5 \end{array}\right] are linearly dependent or linearly independent.

answer.p: The vectors \left[\begin{array}{r} -6 \\ 0 \\ 0 \\ 0 \\ -2 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 2 \\ 2 \\ -6 \\ -6 \\ 0 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -2 \\ 5 \\ 1 \\ 2 \\ -1 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -8 \\ -1 \\ 19 \\ 20 \\ -1 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{r} -5 \\ 4 \\ -1 \\ -4 \\ -5 \end{array}\right] are linearly dependent .
